intro: Didymocheton chrysophyllinus, commonly known as the golden-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, bright yellow leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Its foliage and flowers make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes. The plant is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
